data.title: How would TXT look like in an anime? Find out in this wild Crayon Shin-chan crossover
data.meta_description: Korean boy group Tomorrow X Together enters an extraordinary cross-over in long-running Japanese series Crayon Shin-chan.
data.text:
BIGHIT MUSIC revealed that South Korean boy band Tomorrow X Together (TXT) is teaming up with the beloved Japanese anime Crayon Shin-chan for an extraordinary collaboration.

The news comes as a delightful surprise for fans of both the Korean boy group and anime.

K-pop sensation TXT and Crayon Shin-chan teams up for an amazing cross-over

Crayon Shin-chan, a Japanese anime series that has been captivating audiences for over three decades, since its debut in 1992, will feature animated versions of the K-pop group members in an upcoming special episode titled “TXT Is Here.”

In this unique crossover event, the Korean boy group will be sharing the stage with the mischievous and iconic character Shin-chan, entertaining viewers with their talents.

One of the highlights of this collaboration sees the group teaching Shin-chan a dance routine to their hit song, “Happy Fools,” a fun and memorable segment that fans will surely enjoy.

What makes this collaboration even more special is that the TXT members took the time to record their own dialogue in Japanese for the episode.

This gesture demonstrates their dedication to their Japanese fans and the importance of connecting with the audience in their native language.

Additionally, they recorded their dialogue in Korean for the dubbed version of the series.

The collaboration doesn’t stop at the television series. TXT will also make appearances in the Shin-chan manga, adding an exciting element to the written adventures of the popular character.

In addition, fans can look forward to special merchandise featuring the anime versions of the TXT members, which will definitely become prized collectibles.

The Crayon Shin-chan episode featuring TXT is set to air on Japan’s TV Asahi on October 28.
